verses.plain: Then Job answered and said,

tokens.t: Then Job answered and said,

verses.plain: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

tokens.t: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

verses.plain: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.

tokens.t: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed
ye make yourselves strange to me.

verses.plain: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

tokens.t: And be it indeed
I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

verses.plain: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:

tokens.t: If indeed ye will magnify
against me, and plead against me my reproach:

verses.plain: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

tokens.t: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

verses.plain: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.

tokens.t: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but
no judgment.

verses.plain: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

tokens.t: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

verses.plain: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

tokens.t: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown
my head.

verses.plain: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

tokens.t: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

verses.plain: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.

tokens.t: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as
his enemies.

verses.plain: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

tokens.t: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

verses.plain: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

tokens.t: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

verses.plain: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

tokens.t: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

verses.plain: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

tokens.t: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

verses.plain: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

tokens.t: I called my servant, and he gave
no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

verses.plain: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children’s sake of mine own body.

tokens.t: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children’s
of mine own body.

verses.plain: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.

tokens.t: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.

verses.plain: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

tokens.t: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

verses.plain: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

tokens.t: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

verses.plain: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

tokens.t: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

verses.plain: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

tokens.t: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

verses.plain: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

tokens.t: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

verses.plain: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

tokens.t: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

verses.plain: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:

tokens.t: For I know
my redeemer liveth, and
he shall stand at the latter
upon the earth:

verses.plain: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:

tokens.t: And
after my skin
destroy this
, yet in my flesh shall I see God:

verses.plain: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.

tokens.t: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another;
my reins be consumed within me.

verses.plain: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

tokens.t: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

verses.plain: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.

tokens.t: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath
the punishments of the sword, that ye may know
a judgment.

footnotes.text: make…: or, harden yourselves against me
my…: Heb. the men of my secret
Oh…: Heb. Who will give, etc
And…: or, After I shall awake, though this body be destroyed, yet out of my flesh
though…: or, my reins within me are consumed with earnest desire (for that day)
seeing…: or, and what root of matter is found in me?
